item.title: Dimensionality Reduction in NLP: Visualizing Sentence Embeddings with UMAP and t-SNE
item.description: Dimensionality Reduction in NLP: Visualizing Sentence Embeddings with UMAP and t-SNE # Students: # Yazan Kbaili ( y.kbaili@innopolis.university) Hamada Salhab ( h.salhab@innopolis.university) Introduction # This report delves into the visualization of sentence embeddings derived from the roberta-base model fine-tuned on the “go-emotion” dataset using two prominent dimensionality reduction techniques: UMAP (Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection) and t-SNE (t-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding). The dataset used in the visualization consists of Twitter messages and is called “emotions”.
